data.title: Fantastic
data.text:
We had the most wonderful experience,  really a 5 star B&B.  Attention to every detail is exceptional,   the mansion and furnishings itself are gorgeous.  Evening drinks in one of the lovely sitting rooms was relaxing and breakfast in the beautiful dining room was a pleasure.  You have a few choices for breakfast that you can pick from the evening before,  ours was beautifully presented,  delicious and filling.  When we returned after our night on the town there was a nice plate of deserts waiting for us in our room.  Our room and bathroom were beautifully furnished and decorated,  very comfortable. 
The neighborhood is interesting to walk and safe.
The owners go above and beyond to care for guests and we will stay here again

data.title: Beautiful Historic Home
data.text:
The owner Don is very kind, helpful, and happy to give tours of the mansion and share its history.

The mansion is decorated with period pieces and it is like walking back in time. 

Great relaxing atmosphere.

The only thing I would say could be better is breakfast options.

data.title: Go Inside and Be Amazed
data.text: As we walked up to the B and B, I was extremely worried as the exterior is in very poor repair. My husband and I looked at each other as tho to say...what will we do now?(end of that story is that they are on the list next for complete outdoor redo) And then the door open and it was like Alice in Wonderland. UNBELIEVABLE and lavish. I have been to easily more than 100 B and Bs and this rates as one of the top decorated/collected I have seen worldwide. Antique working elevator. Only suggestion might be , the owners is very pleasant but a bit more quiet/private time for guests would be good. Chocolates on bed, hand written note of welcome...etc I could go on.

data.title: Overnight visit
data.text: Magnificent B&B. Owner is incredibly knowledgeable about Macon and the history of the mansion. Accommodations are beautiful. If you are driving through Macon it is worth stopping. Very accommodating for my broken foot. Elevator is over 100 years old and is still working.

data.title: Beautiful setting, wonderful service
data.text: Burke Mansion is a beautiful mansion centrally located a few blocks from downtown Macon.  The interior is gorgeously furnished with antiques and the bedrooms are large and wonderfully decorated.  The hosts not only made a delicious breakfast but also served a nice afternoon cheese plate and an evening snack.  I highly recommend a stay at this property.

data.title: Great and wonderful
data.text: We were very impressed by the interior decoration of the "Burke Mansion". The room superbly furnished. I admire Don and Pino and how to keep the house in high-gloss, and the two do everything alone, super! Don may very well about the history of family Burke tell, very interesting. And it can also be very many good tips for restaurant and city of Macon. Many thanks

data.title: Take a trip back in time to stay in a magnificent mansion with amazing hosts.
data.text: We reserved two suits for a wedding and could not spend nearly enough time in the home as we would have liked.  The Burke Mansion surpassed all our expectation and then some! Don will provide a colorful tour of the home and explain its history. He has a warm personality and is a fine host. Pino, said to be the shy host in the back, let me into his kitchen and allowed me to watch him perform and enjoy hearing his stories - good fun! During our stay we were served a wonderful breakfast, a wine and cheese plate in the afternoon and fantastic late night deserts. Don't miss the French Toast and the unusually good Chicken Sausage.  Don and Pino, thanks for your kindness. Your B and B is a much better alternative to a hotel. I invite all to check out their web page.  Everything you read is true!  By the way, don't forget to check out their elevator!

data.title: Delightful B & B in Macon
data.text: Lovely stop after a long drive! The beds were comfy and the rooms spacious, with everything you need. The kind and interesting owner, Don, made sure we were well taken care of. From wine and cheese in the evening to wonderful dessert awaiting us after our return from dinner, we didn't want to leave. Then, the most incredible breakfast! French Toast Napolean! Highly recommended.

data.title: Burke Mansion is like being with Family!
data.text: We visited a few weeks ago for a one night stay.  So glad we did.  The inn keepers are really special people.  They treated us better than family.  Very kind and willing to get us anything we needed to have a great stay.  All was perfect from the inn to the food.  Special thanks to the man behind the kitchen door who made our breakfast.  I like French toast but his was the best I had in a long time.  Don made our one night stay special and I can't say enough about him.  The inn is beautifully decorated with antiques and crystal.   We truly enjoyed our stay!

data.title: Burke Mansion Getaway
data.text: The Burke Mansion is a wonderfully restored Victorian Mansion. Don is very knowledgeable of the history of the house and takes great pride in the facility. The recommendations for local cuisine were spot on, and the nightly dessert provided was delicious. The room was spotlessly clean, and the period bathroom for the rooms were delightful. The cooked to order breakfast in the morning was delicious. Will recommend this location to friends and family, and will definitely be back when the chance arises.

data.title: GREAT FIND!!
data.text: Excellent overnight stay on the way to Savannah.  Don was very understanding with our late night check in due to unexpected weather delays.  Breakfast was very good the next morning and chats about history of house was an added bonus.  Will definitely be back!

data.title: "A step back in time"
data.text: Beautiful place, great location (walk to downtown) and TLC from hosts make this a 5 Star in my book. We were given tips on the best places to visit and the best time to go. Restaurants were suggested and we did indeed enjoy the cuisine.The breakfasts were delicious as were the decadent desserts later in the evenings. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

data.title: Welcome to the genteel south!
data.text: A fabulous experience that puts you in the charms of days gone by with the high end service of a luxury hotel.  The experience was amazing and the rooms were so well appointed.  Everything from the welcome at the front door to the wine and cheese upon arrival to the incredible breakfast to the desserts at turn down are over the top.  Make a trip just to enjoy this beautiful mansion.

data.title: Fancy, Affordable, Exceptional Service
data.text: Passed through Macon traveling down I75; had a quick but enjoyable stay at the Burke Mansion. Chose here with the goal of a different experience vs a hotel stay and we couldn't have been more satisfied. It felt like we were visiting (a very wealthy) family member. The rooms are lush, every ammenity one could dream of needing. What hotel greets you with a glass of wine and cheese plate? Turns down your bed and leaves a dessert tray? Brings coffee and egg sandwiches to your room to accomidate your early departure? Never had an experience to match this. The beds were extremely comfortable and very quiet house. We highly recommend you try this out!

data.title: Amazing stay.
data.text: We just finished a 4 night stay here for my husband's 60th  Birthday.   It was nothing short of phenomenal.    Our hosts really proved that Southern hospitality is alive and well.   They really went above and beyond.  Not to mention that the mansion is absolutely gorgeous and our room was wonderful.    and the food !   Incredible breakfast, snacks and desserts.   I really can't say enough good things about our stay.   We hope to go back next year.

data.title: Delightful!
data.text: Our recent stay at Burke Mansion was the most delightful B&B experience we have ever had...from the moment my husband and I stepped through the door until we reluctantly had to leave. Don is the perfect host and the house is absolutely stunning. Our room was lovely, with luxurious linens on the comfortable bed and a bathroom that was spacious, well lit and immaculately clean. When we returned in the evening after having a nice dinner at Natalia's, we found a wonderful dessert tray waiting for us in our room. We knew then that we were in for a treat in the morning! Breakfast was delicious! Unlike most B&Bs, it was nice to have a selection to choose from. Before leaving, we made reservations to return for a special occasion. We can hardly wait to spend another night in this beautiful home.

data.title: Fab Night in Macon Georgia
data.text: The Burke Mansion has been beautifully restored and furnished. Don is the consummate host, and Pino is a great cook/baker. I felt welcomed, comfortable, and relaxed during my stay. I highly recommend the french toast Napoleon for breakfast. Overall, I give the property my highest recommendation, and I look forward to my return.

data.title: Southern Charm!
data.text: Firstly, the home is truly a breath taking time capsule!  Pictures don't do it justice!  Don is the best!  He is the most friendly, gracious, and warm host!  He is always close by to offer refreshing drinks, wine, and snacks.  His knowledge of antiques, which fill the home, and of the history of the home and area are amazing!  Breakfast was amazing and fit for a cover photo on Southern Living magazine!  Downtown has many very nice restaurants as well.   We have been to many bed and breakfasts over the years and the Burke Mansion is in a class all its own!  We can't stop telling people about it and excited are to stay again soon!  So just book a night and thanks me later!

data.title: Wonderful Bed and Breakfast
data.text:
Our daughter told us about this great B&B so we just had to try it on a short anniversary trip. It met our expectations and more. Don't be put off by the large wrap around porch that needs some work. The owner, Don, is in the process of meeting all the requirements and regulations that you have to jump through when you're restoring an historic property.
The interior is gorgeous, and the furnishings look like they were original to the house. Every time you step back into a room, you see something that you missed the first time. Don and Pino have both collected so many beautiful thing, (Don't miss the clock collection and Don's collection of china.).
A big plus for us was the antique elevator that helps so much with luggage when you have to deal with stairs.
Don was the perfect host, friendly, knows the history of Macon so well, and even drove us to and from the restaurant we chose for dinner!
We stayed in the Martina and Mae Suite and it was lovely. The bathroom was small and had a pedestal sink, so didn't have much room, but that's to be expected since this was originally a sewing room and was converted into a bedroom. The lighting was very good, I really appreciated that when putting on makeup. (So many (B&B's and hotels have such poor lighting.)
The food, breakfast, Hors d'oeuvres in the afternoon and dessert at night (homemade cookies and coffee), was delicious! You are given a choice of the time you want your breakfast and can pick what you want from 3 or 4 items. My husband had Stuffed French toast, so good, and I had the Belgian Waffle, equally as good, with a choice of breakfast meats. Very, very good and the table was so pretty. 
We enjoyed our stay so much and will definitely will stay there again next time we are in the area.

data.title: Luxurious find in Macon...simply the best experience ever!!!
data.text:
Was visiting family in Macon for the weekend and stumbled across this hotel on the internet.  Originally planned on staying at your run of the mill Hilton or equivalent but boy am I glad we chose this place instead.  First allow me to say Don was the most attentive and gracious host who attended to our every need.  He made us feel as though we were old friends visiting from out of town, not just clients.  Everything about the mansion exudes luxury.  The decor was immaculate, meticulously designed.  You immediately feel invited from the minute you pull into the driveway.  We spent most of our time on the large veranda enjoying our complimentary glass of wine and chatting with Don.  We stayed in the "Mary Burke" room which is one of the two largest guest rooms in the mansion.  We felt as though we had the entire mansion to ourselves even though there were other guests staying.  We even cut our time short with family to come back and enjoy the evening at the mansion...LOL!  Breakfast was exquisite.  We had the recommended french toast benedict with applewood bacon.  Our only regret is that we stayed for one night.  We will definitely visit again whether we are in Macon or just passing through.  This mansion alone is worth visiting Macon.  I encourage anyone to experience this magnificent place, you will not be disappointed.  Can't wait to go back.

Thanks Don & Pinot!
Sincerely
Anthony & Keisha
